chapter.title: JavaDoc
chapter.para: Most of the documentation about the CDK classes is done in the java source files itself. The format used for this is the JavaDoc format. An overview/introduction can be found at http://java.sun.com/j2se/javadoc/writingdoccomments/.

JavaDoc documentation is now generated using Javadoc and Ant:
cdk/$ ant -buildfile javadoc.xml html

section.title: JavaDoc Tags
section.para: The two sub sections contain suggested policy and is not yet as such approved.

section.title: Tagging classes
Tagging procedures
section.para: Procedures of classes should give information about what they do and information about parameters (@param) and things they return (@return).

If the procedure performs a method found in literature, it should mention the reference. No format for the reference has been determined, but the BibTex format, or a link to http://cdk.sf.net/biblio.html#ARTID should do fine.

section.title: DocbookDoclet
section.para: The JavaDoc documentation can be converted into DocBook code with the DocBookDoclet (http://freshmeat.net/projects/dbdoclet/). The DocBook output can in turn be generated into PDF files.

section.title: JavaDoc Statistics
section.para:
Statistics can be generated on the use of JavaDoc in the CDK library. It can be generated with:
$ cd cdk/doc/javadoc $ ant -Dpathtojava3d=/some/path overview

section.title: Keyword Index
section.para:
A keyword index is used for the website and is generated with the MakeKeywordIndexDoclet doclet. The file keyword.index.xml can be generated with:
$ cd cdk/doc/javadoc $ ant -Dpathtojava3d=/some/path keyword.index
